parameters.content:
## Accepted Tokens Config 

You must edit the payment tokens `config` object in the `Lookup Payments Config` node with the token details of all tokens you wish to support with your facilitator. 

*Important*: Be sure to import the contract methods for the appropriate tokens into your 1Shot API node.

## Supported Networks Config

Be sure to update the `Supported Networks Config` node to reflect the networks you have configured your 1Shot API account to process.

## Example Facilitator Curl Request

Here is a complete curl request you can use to test your node:

```sh
curl -X POST \
  https://n8n.1shotapi.dev/webhook-test/settle \
  -H "User-Agent: CustomUserAgent/1.0" \
  -H "Accept: application/json" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "x402Version": 1,
    "paymentHeader": "",
    "paymentRequirements": {
      "scheme": "exact",
      "network": "base-sepolia",
      "maxAmountRequired": "5000000",
      "resource": "https://n8n.1shotapi.dev/webhook/gas-station",
      "description": "Swap stablecoins for gas tokens",
      "mimeType": "",
      "payTo": "0x9fEad8B19C044C2f404dac38B925Ea16ADaa2954",
      "maxTimeoutSeconds": 150,
      "asset": "0x036CbD53842c5426634e7929541eC2318f3dCF7e",
      "extra": {
        "name": "USD Coin",
        "version": "version"
      }
    }
  }'
```

## Create Your 1Shot API Credential

Don't forget to authenticate against your 1Shot API business by creating an n8n credential. 

Click on one of the 1Shot API nodes, then click on `Credential to connect with`, then enter you API key, secret, and business id.
